Type.Name: TemplateControl

TypeSignature.Value: public abstract class TemplateControl : System.Web.UI.Control, System.Web.UI.IFilterResolutionService, System.Web.UI.INamingContainer

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the <link location="node:gtk-sharp/programming/threads">Gtk# Thread Programming</link> for details.

remarks.para: The class is an abstract class that provides common properties and methods for the class and the class. A new instance of the is not created directly.
The class defines methods supporting declarative data-binding expressions:

item.para: Use the method for data-binding expression involving data sources, such as simple properties or expressions.
Use the method for parsing and evaluating an XPath data-binding expression.
Use the method for data-binding against an expression containing an XPath select statement. The result is a node collection that implements the interface.

remarks.para: For more information on data-binding expression, see Data Binding Expression Syntax and ASP.NET Data Binding.

summary.para: Provides the class and the class with a base set of functionality.

remarks.para: The constructor is not called directly.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Occurs when a user ends a transaction.

remarks.para: When the file that defines a control resides in a directory other than that of the page processing the request, use the property to return the application-relative, virtual path to the .
The property is set based on the virtual path that is set in the property.

summary.para: Gets or sets the application-relative, virtual directory path to the file from which the control is parsed and compiled.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual int AutoHandlers { set; get; }

Docs.value: To be added: an object of type 'int'

summary.para: The property has been deprecated in ASP.NET NETÂ 2.0. It is used by generated classes and is not intended for use within your code.
Occurs when a transaction completes.

remarks.para: The method allows design-time code execution of the and controls.

summary.para: Performs design-time logic.

MemberSignature.Value: protected System.Web.UI.LiteralControl CreateResourceBasedLiteralControl (int offset, int size, bool fAsciiOnly);

remarks.para: The method is used to access literal strings that are stored in a resource and is not intended for use from within your code.

summary.para: Accesses literal strings stored in a resource. The method is not intended for use from within your code.

returns.para: A representing a literal string in a resource.

Docs.param: The offset of the start of the string in the resource.
The size of the string in bytes.
A Boolean value indicating if the string in the resource contains only 7-bit ASCII characters.

summary.para: Occurs when an unhandled exception is thrown.

remarks.para: The value of must evaluate to a public property.
The method calls the method using the method to resolve the object reference that the expression is evaluated against.

summary.para: Evaluates a data-binding expression.

returns.para: An object that results from the evaluation of the data-binding expression.

Docs.param: The navigation path from the container to the public property value to place in the bound control property.

MemberSignature.Value: protected string Eval (string expression, string format);

remarks.para: The value of must evaluate to a public property.
The method calls the method using the method to resolve the object reference that the expression is evaluated against.

summary.para: Evaluates a data-binding expression using the specified format string to display the result.

returns.para: A string that results from the evaluation of the data-binding expression and conversion to a string type.

Docs.param: The navigation path from the container to the public property value to place in the bound control property.
A .NET Framework format string to apply to the result.

remarks.para: Do not override the method.

remarks.para: If the control supports caching, the object returned from the method is not actually a object; rather, it is a object. If the parameter is relative, the path of the loaded control is relative to the path of the .

When you load a control into a container control, the container raises all of the added control's events until it has caught up to the current event. However, the added control does not catch up with postback data processing. For an added control to participate in postback data processing, including validation, the control must be added in the event rather than in the event.

summary.para: Loads a object from a file based on a specified virtual path.

returns.para: Returns the specified .

Docs.param: The virtual path to a control file.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Web.UI.Control LoadControl (Type type, object[] parameters);

Docs.param: To be added.

remarks.para: If the user control supports caching, the object returned from the method is not actually a object; rather, it is a object.

When you load a control into a container control, the container raises all of the added control's events until it has caught up to the current event. However, the added control does not catch up with postback data processing. For an added control to participate in postback data processing, including validation, the control must be added in the event rather than in the event.

summary.para: Loads a object based on a specified type and constructor parameters.

returns.para: Returns the specified .

Docs.param: An array of arguments that match in number, order, and type the parameters of the constructor to invoke. If is an empty array or null, the constructor that takes no parameters (the default constructor) is invoked.

remarks.para: The parameter contains a user control, such as you would find in an .ascx file. This string cannot contain any code, because the method never causes compilation.

returns.para: The parsed .

Docs.param: A string that contains a user control.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Web.UI.Control ParseControl (string content, bool ignoreParserFilter);

remarks.para: The parameter contains a user control (the contents of an .ascx file). This string cannot contain any code, because the method never causes compilation.
The parameter allows the class to be ignored. The class is used by the ASP.NET parser to determine whether an item is allowed in the page at parse time.

summary.para: Parses an input string into a object on the ASP.NET Web page or user control.

returns.para: The parsed control.

Docs.param: A string that contains a user control.
A value that specifies whether to ignore the parser filter.

remarks.para: The method is not intended for use from within your code.

Docs.param: An object representing the pointer to the string resource.
The resource size.

Docs.value: To be added: an object of type 'bool'

remarks.para: The property indicates whether automatic events are supported. The property is read-only and is true for all cases.

summary.para: Gets a value indicating whether the control supports automatic events.

remarks.para: The method is part of the interface, which is specific to how a control uses device filters in a designer environment. When controls are parsed or persisted in the designer environment outside the context of a browser request, the provides a way to determine if the current control is affected by a named filter and whether a named filter is part of a specific device-filter hierarchy.

summary.para: Returns a value that indicates whether a parent/child relationship exists between two specified device filters.

returns.para: 1, if is a parent of ; -1, if is a parent of ; otherwise, 0, if there is no parent/child relationship between and .

Docs.param: A device filter name.
A device filter name.

remarks.para: The method is part of the interface, which is specific to how a control uses device filters in a designer environment. When controls are parsed or persisted in the designer environment outside the context of a browser request, the provides a way to determine if the current control is affected by a named filter and whether a named filter is part of a specific device-filter hierarchy.

summary.para: Returns a value that indicates whether the specified filter is a type of the current filter object.

returns.para: true if the specified filter is a type applicable to the current filter object; otherwise, false.

Docs.param: The name of a device filter.
